input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.style: width:70%;margin:0 auto;padding-bottom:20px;

span.div: Due to the state-wide closure of public schools, the Scioto Valley Local School District will be closed for the rest of the school year.
Please call Jasper daily from 10:00-12:00 to schedule and appointment 740-289-2425.

One parent/caregiver per appointment. Please do not bring your child. It is important for you to bring the following documents: birth certificate, social security card, shot records, proof of residence (ex: utility bill or valid driver's license), custody papers if applicable.

Appointments will be held in the cafeteria so please park on the side of the building near the playground and plan on staying about 30 minutes to complete the paperwork. Registration tables will be setup to promote social distancing.
We look forward to meeting you soon and are excited to meet your Little Streak in the fall!!

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

br.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

br.span: Due to Governor Dewine’s order to stay at home for the remainder of the school year and the Ohio Department of Education’s requirements to continue providing instructional materials to our students, we will be sending one last packet to all students at Jasper and to those without internet resources at the high school. Some teachers will continue providing online instruction during this time. This work will be due on Friday, May 15 for the high school grades 6-12 and Wednesday, May 20 for Jasper students grades K-5.

br.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

br.span: Teachers and staff will be reaching out to students to check on their well being, offer any support they can give, and find out how many of our students have access to online learning in case we would have to be on a modified schedule next year. Please don’t hesitate to reach out to your children’s teachers as well. We are here to help and support our Redstreaks socially, emotionally, and academically!

div.style: font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff
font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff;text-align:left

span.div: Below is a list of important upcoming dates:

div.style: font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff
font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff;text-align:left
div.strong: Thursday, April 9 - All work assignments for the first three weeks of the school outage was due

div.style: font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff;text-align:left
div.strong: Friday, May 1 - All April work assignments are DUE
Friday May 15, May work due for Grades 6-12
Wednesday May 20, May work due for Grades K-5

div.style: font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff
font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff;text-align:left

span.div: There will be totes placed in front of both Piketon High School and Jasper Elementary School for work to be dropped off. They will be labeled by grade-level. Please make sure your student's name is on his/her paper packet/assignment. If you want to turn in the work before the deadlines, please feel free to do so.

div.style: font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff
font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff;text-align:left

span.div: If you need to contact one of your child's teachers, please refer to the list of preferred communications on our district website. Please don't stress about grades. These assignments will simply be pass/fail. We are basically asking for EFFORT!

div.style: font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff
font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff;text-align:left

span.div: Thank you for your support during this time. We encourage our students to continue seeking new learning opportunities and making the best of this situation!

div.style: font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff
font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff;text-align:left
text-align: center
text-align: center

span.strong: Governor Dewine has extended the school closure through May 1st.

span.b: More information regarding this extension and how it will affect the rest of the academic school year will be given out as soon as possible

div.style: text-align: center

strong.span: High School Students - College Credit Plus,
If you are interested in taking college classes for the 2020-21 school year, you must complete the

u.b: 2 INTENT forms and email them to Mrs. Fout (sherry[email protected]) by April 1st.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
div.span: (you must reapply even if you were in the program this year or previous years). Please read the document below "CCP Information from Shawnee State" thoroughly regarding deadlines, testing, application, etc. The two intent forms are listed below as well.

strong.span: The Scioto Valley Local School District will be distributing

food for our district families. If you would like to have food packaged for your children, Please call 740-289-4117 and leave a message with your name, address, phone number, the number of children in the household, and if you prefer Piketon High School or Jasper Elementary for food pickup.
You only need to call once
to be added to the list. You do not need to call for each pickup day.
Food pickups will be at Jasper Elementary and Piketon High School from 11-12 on Tuesdays and Fridays.

In addition to the Jasper Elementary and Piketon High School locations. Food will also be delivered to: Vansant Commons at Shyville, Moore Meadows, Sugar Tree, and Fox Run Apartments. Food will also be available at the Camp Creek, Elm Grove, and Scioto Township fire houses, and the Seal Township building on 220. Meals should arrive at these locations around 11:00 am.

p.span: During this state-wide school outage, communicating between student/parent and teacher is more important than ever. If your child has a question regarding their homework assignment, please click the link below to see how your teachers will be getting information to you, as well as answering questions you may have...

strong.span: ee communication information for your teachers

span.strong: NOTICE OF PROPOSED CLASS ACTION SETTLEMENT

span.div: This includes students with disabilities in Ohio’s public schools , including those who have or could have an individualized education program (IEP) or a Section 504 plan. Click the link below to view the notice.

div.a: Notice of Proposed Class Action Settlement

div.span: The Scioto Valley Board of Education does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, religion, military status, ancestry, genetic information (collectively, "Protected Classes"), or any other legally protected category, in its programs and activities, including employment opportunities.

div.style: text-align: center;

span.div: The Scioto Valley Local School District participates in the School Meal Programs and free and reduced price meals are offered.
The Scioto Valley Website is maintained by high school students enrolled in Web Design at Piketon High School.
